results.title: Good things come in small packages
results.creator_credit: Leeanne Hill, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sam came up to Leeanne Hill and asked her for a hug, a friendship started that has only become stronger over the years. These best friends are there for each other through everything, including Hill’s struggle with Turner’s Syndrome.

results.title: Dr Phil's story
results.creator_credit: Phil Bergman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.

results.title: Diary of a backpack
results.creator_credit: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabrielle Guaran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Hidden treasure : thoughts about living with Turner's Syndrome : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
Turner’s Syndrome affects one in every 2000-2500 females. A genetic disorder due to the absence of an X chromosome, it usually leads to growth difficulties, infertility and, in some cases, learning difficulties, particularly with mathematics and spatial relationships.
These twelve stories are by those who have lived with Turner’s Syndrome, either by being diagnosed with it or caring for a child with the disorder. The inspiring stories are about living with Turner’s Syndrome and not letting it prevent them from living a normal life.
results.title_for_label: Hidden treasure : thoughts about living with Turner’s Syndrome : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Turner's Syndrome : trials and triumphs
results.creator_credit: Jackie Breasley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jackie Breasley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Let me explain...
results.creator_credit: Samantha Van Zanen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Samantha Van Zanen’s story starts with a dramatic childbirth but mostly reflects on the darkest years of her life as she coped with having Turner’s Syndrome. The bullying, needles and anguish were alleviated somewhat by her family and close friends.

results.title: Tonia Todman's craft room
results.brief_description: Tonia Todman hosts this interesting series of videos about various craft ideas that can be done quickly and easily at home.
results.description: Tonia Todman hosts this interesting series of videos about various craft ideas that can be done quickly and easily at home.

group_works.title: Stencilling
group_works.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video

results.title: Paper making
results.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tonia Todman’s craft room”.
Tonia Todman demonstrates how to make paper. She describes how to create interesting effects through the addition of grasses, seeds, flowers, and threads to your paper pulp. How to emboss or add a watermark to your paper is also explained. As well as recycling scrap paper, Tonia demonstrates how to produce paper from leaves and other natural products, and also from rags.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video
results.description:
Episode of Series “Tonia Todman’s craft room”.

How to emboss or add a watermark to your paper is also explained. As well as recycling scrap paper, Tonia demonstrates how to produce paper from leaves and other natural products, and also from rags.

group_siblings.title: Stencilling
group_siblings.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video

results.title: Stencilling
results.creator_credit: John Dobis, Sheridan Stumm and Discovery Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tonia Todman’s craft room”.
Stencilling, a craft that started thousands of years ago with primitive cave painting has become increasingly popular in recent years. It is a very adaptable and creative way for the home decorator to personalise his or her home in a way that is appealing and inexpensive. Tonia Todman tells you all you need to know to be able to enhance your home with charming stencilled designs. Stencils can be applied to your walls, floors, tables, cupboards, beds, boxes, trays, fabrics, the list goes on. Their application can stretch as far as your imagination takes you, to give your home and homeware a unique, picturesque and individual touch. Tonia tells you how to plan and design a stencil, how to transfer designs, how to position and space your stencils for the most effective results, and describes painting techniques and the choice of colour schemes.
